entry.title: The 118 Job
entry.summary:
Author: lifewithferg

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 41,414Chapters: 12/12Kudos: 26

Summary: Maddie exhales deeply, sinking back into the chair as the screens all flip to black, Karen having turned off the feed. She slowly moves to the table, very aware of the eyes on her. Sitting down, she looks at Bobby and Athena, who are both looking at her with a shared expression of mischief. ‚ÄúWhat?‚Äù She asks innocently, ‚ÄúI like making sure they‚Äôre safe, is all.‚Äù ‚ÄúMaddie, that was the easiest job they‚Äôve both done in months. They could have done it blindfolded, with their hands tied behind their backs in broad daylight and have been fine,‚Äù Athena‚Äôs quick response is sharp, but teasing. _________ Or: The 118 are a team who operate on the wrong side of the law. Heists and chaos are all part of the fun until the stakes are raised when one of their own becomes leverage.

entry.title: We never used to do that (we don‚Äôt do that)
entry.summary:
Author: callmecranberry

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 57,771Chapters: 7/8Kudos: 168

Summary: ‚ÄúWhat the fuck, Buck. Look at us! We don‚Äôt do this, man. You can‚Äôt just up and leave after things get hard!‚Äù Eddie wasn‚Äôt sure how to stop being angry, how to not put everything on Buck, but his best friend leaving sure wasn‚Äôt helping. ‚ÄúOh, but you can?‚Äù Buck snarled and Eddie looked at him in disbelief. ‚ÄúYou‚Ä¶No. We‚Äôve been over this. I know that you don‚Äôt think that I‚Ä¶‚Äù Eddie was lost for words but Buck quickly started speaking instead. ‚ÄúThat you what, Eddie? That you didn‚Äôt leave? That you haven‚Äôt changed? That we haven‚Äôt changed? Because we sure as hell did. And El Paso wasn‚Äôt the first time you did it. It is your fucking thing." Or In the midst of their grief, Buck and Eddie fell out of their usual rhythm and went into two completely different directions. After a fight that took way too much from both of them and after the news that Eddie and Chris were staying in LA, Buck decided to move out and leave this thing between him and Eddie behind. Or Buck and Eddie have another divorce era right after the events of s8e17. We ignore everything that happened after that episode. Chris is a sweetheart, Maddie Buckley-Han is amazing and Tommy is only here as a plot device.

entry.title: Serendipity
entry.summary:
Author: not_straight118

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 66,531Chapters: 35/?Kudos: 224

Summary: Evan ‚ÄúBuck‚Äù Buckley and his older sister Maddie were adopted by firefighter captain Bobby Nash and his retired cop wife Athena Grant. Buck grew up hard of hearing as long as he could remember. To communicate he speaks and uses American Sign Language, and his sister is completely deaf she only uses American Sign Language.*Eddie Diaz grew up in Texas but when he gets in a car wreck his wife passes away and their five year old son loses his hearing. Eddie found a school for the deaf in Los Angeles. With that he packs their bags and moves to LA.*What happens when two walks of life meet?

entry.title: Eddie + Hot surf instructor = gay
entry.summary:
Author: Mgsquared

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 4,362Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 64

Summary: ‚ÄúHey buddy! Did you have a good lesson?‚Äù ‚ÄúYeah! Buck is the best teacher. I had so much fun!‚Äù Buck? Weird name but Eddie can work with it. His military background made him immune to all sorts of monikers. ‚ÄúBuck?‚Äù‚ÄúYup! That‚Äôs me!‚Äù Mr. Greek god Buck shook Eddie‚Äôs hand enthusiastically. Man he was cute. Total golden retriever energy. ‚ÄúEddie‚Äù he grinned back shaking just as enthusiastically and wondering if Buck also felt the spark when their hands connected.‚ÄúChris did a fantastic job today! You should be so proud.‚Äù Buck beamed down at the kid that beamed back up and wasn‚Äôt that a sight. Eddie felt a bit drunk honestly. He had said it like any other teacher too, none of that ‚Äúwooowww a kid with CP can do stuff‚Äù bullshit Eddie usually got.He might be in love.

Summary: Buck could ring her hands over and over. it was bad enough that she got blown up by a fire truck. It was bad enough she'd spent 5 months under lock and key. entry.title: The Diaz Study on Long-Term Exposure to the Buckley Variable: Statistically Significant, Emotionally Catastrophic, and Unmodeled
entry.summary:
Author: DamnSterek

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 10,570Chapters: 2/?Kudos: 36

Summary: Abstract: In a longitudinal assessment of the Buckley variable‚Äôs impact on Dr. Diaz, we document a surprising decline in objectivity, an alarming spike in flustered rambling, and multiple methodological failures including‚Äîbut not limited to‚Äîaccidental staring, uncontrolled blushing, and an unprecedented disregard for professional boundaries. Despite repeated replication attempts, no reliable strategy for emotional neutrality was found. The data strongly support the hypothesis that Subject Buckley is hazardous to academic composure. Peer review pending. Further study (and possibly therapy) is recommended. --- TLDR: A Buddie AU where rockstar!Buck crashes straight into professor!Eddie‚Äôs quiet life‚Ä¶ and absolutely wrecks him (emotionally and physically).

entry.title: A Very Buddie Christmas
entry.summary:
Author: DianneRose2016

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 11,842Chapters: 3/24Kudos: 51

Summary: Firefighter Evan ‚ÄúBuck‚Äù Buckley has never needed a reason to show up for Eddie Diaz and his son Christopher. especially at Christmas. From tree shopping to gingerbread disasters, the three of them have their holiday traditions down to a science. But when Eddie‚Äôs relationship with Ana starts to strain under the weight of those traditions, Buck is forced to confront a truth he‚Äôs been trying to ignore: He doesn‚Äôt just love being part of their family. He loves them. As the countdown to Christmas ticks closer and tempers flare, Buck and Eddie must decide what, and who, makes a home feel like Christmas. And some wishes don‚Äôt fit under a tree‚Ä¶ They‚Äôre found sitting beside you the whole time. A slow-burn Buddie holiday romance full of warmth, laughter, and the magic of choosing love.

entry.title: Mayday, we're going down
